title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 February 2016 - XWiki
content:

00:14 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki

09:18 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <Pbas> Hi, FYI Authors filter doesn't work to select extensions with livetable: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&authors=Vincent  
10:34 <vmassol> yes I know Pbas  
10:34 <vmassol> you need to use the full referednce  
10:35 <vmassol> xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol  
10:35 <vmassol> AFAIK  
10:35 <vmassol> yep works  
10:35 <vmassol> we have a jira issue for this already  
10:37 <Pbas> Ok thxs  
10:37 <Pbas> Vincent about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12570 (Access right doesn't work well with subgroups)  
10:38 <Pbas> Do you think I must create a groovy script to add subgroup member on a root group?  
10:39 <Pbas> because we encoutered this bug randomly during the week  
10:39 <vmassol> Pbas: I'm in a meeting right now and I don't know the topic well, would need to read up  
10:39 <Pbas> Ok thxs sorry  
10:43 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> hi acotiuga, good to see you here :)  
10:48 <vmassol> acotiuga: question: are you the owner of the extensions you're releasing?  
10:49 <acotiuga> no  
10:49 <vmassol> if not then you need to ask the owner before doing a release.  
10:49 <vmassol> ok that's a problem  
10:49 <vmassol> how are you releasing the versions from jira?  
10:49 <vmassol> (since you're not the owner)  
10:53 <vmassol> maybe we need to remove this rule… we need to finish this discussion http://markmail.org/message/ppiezx4czeytf4zx  
10:53 <vmassol> but we need to solve the release process issue with jirz  
10:55 <acotiuga> It the owner of an app mentioned somewhere ?  
10:55 <vmassol> yes, in jira  
10:55 <vmassol> that's the lead in jira  
10:55 <vmassol> for ex for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAMEETINGS it's Anca  
10:57 <acotiuga> And that's Bandou Lyes  
10:57 <vmassol> for which project?  
10:58 <vmassol> (acotiuga)  
10:58 <acotiuga> for forum  
10:59 <vmassol> since Lyes is MIA, would you be interested to become the new lead?  
10:59 <acotiuga> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAFORUM  
10:59 <acotiuga> sure  
10:59 <vmassol> done you're now the lead! congrats! :)  
10:59 <acotiuga> If nobody's against this  
10:59 <acotiuga> thanks :)  
11:00 <vmassol> please don't forget to perform releases of versions jira  
11:00 <vmassol> and to create new versions  
11:00 <vmassol> s/versions jira/versions in jira  
11:02 <vmassol> and if you've done other releases please contact the leads to do this  
11:02 <vmassol> (acotiuga)  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> Congrats acotiuga :)  
11:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <acotiuga> Thank you!  
11:51 <vmassol> acotiuga: you know what to do for the version releasing in jira?  
11:52 <acotiuga> I marked the version as released and I added release date  
11:55 <vmassol> ok great thanks  
11:55 <vmassol> and created new versions?  
11:55 <vmassol> (for future creation of jiras)  
12:00 <vmassol> (acotiuga)  
12:12 <vmassol> acotiuga: btw why not release meeting app v1.10 instead of doing bug fix releases for non bug fixes :)  
12:12 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/ForumApplication#HReleaseNotes  
12:13 <vmassol> doesn't look right… :)  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> yes it could have been 1.10, but I think we haven't any recommandation about versioning  
12:25 <vmassol> we do actually  
12:25 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/VersioningAndReleasePractices  
12:25 <vmassol> very precise :)  
12:26 <vmassol> " • Bugfix Releases (x.y.1, x.y.2): Contains only bug fixes and is 100% backward compatible. It's always recommended to upgrade as soon as possible since the bug fixes can contain security fixes.  
12:27 <vmassol> you can argue that this for platform and not for extensions though  
12:27 <vmassol> and each extension defines its own rule  
12:27 <vmassol> we need to fix this asap btw  
12:27 <vmassol> I'll start working on standardizing this real soon  
12:28 <vmassol> but here it's more like someone thought that after 1.9 it has to be 2.0  
12:28 <vmassol> (and not 1.10)  
12:40 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:43 <vmassol> has quit  
13:38 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:18 <vmassol1> acotiuga: that should have been 2.1 IMO since 2.0.6 is not a bugfix release, TBD w/ mflorea  
15:18 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
15:19 <acotiuga> It was discussed with mflorea  
15:19 <vmassol> ok then we need to better agree about the rules for FM. I thought they should follow the dev.xwiki.org rules mflorea?  
15:20 <vmassol> (ie http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/VersioningAndReleasePractices )  
15:21 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't see the problem  
15:21 <vmassol> it was a bugfix release with no bug fixes :)  
15:22 <vmassol> sounds strange to me  
15:22 <mflorea> it has minor improvements, it doesn't deserve a new version  
15:22 <vmassol> then you're defining some new rules  
15:22 <vmassol> which is ok but needs to be discussed  
15:22 <vmassol> becasue that's not what we have ATM  
15:23 <vmassol> minor is the second number  
15:23 <vmassol> not the third  
15:23 <vmassol> in A.B.C  
15:24 <vmassol> so maybe we should change the definition of "bugfix", i.e. the third number?  
15:24 <vmassol> but we would need a defintion  
15:24 <vmassol> FTR we also have the same issue with XWiki releases  
15:25 <vmassol> for example when we release 7.4.1 it doesn't only contain bugfixes (even though it's supposed to)  
15:25 <mflorea> vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=10010&version=16282  
15:25 <mflorea> I see many improvement and even some new feature  
15:26 <vmassol> yes and?  
15:26 <vmassol> (did you see what I wrote above?)  
15:26 <vmassol> right now the version numbering for extensions is kind of a joke  
15:26 <vmassol> there are no 2 extensions that do the same  
15:27 <mflorea> we haven't been following this rule very strictly, which is fine for me  
15:27 <vmassol> well not exactly  
15:27 <mflorea> in some cases you may need/want to include an improvement in a minor version  
15:28 <vmassol> when?  
15:28 <vmassol> what's the difference between minor and "more minor"?  
15:28 <vmassol> that's what we need to define  
15:28 <vmassol> for xwiki releases we don't put stuff that are not bugfix in general, we put those for the next minor release  
15:29 <vmassol> when we have improvemnts it's usually because they are needed to fix bugs/issues that make the predvious version not very usable  
15:29 <vmassol> anyway all I'm saying that right now I don't see the difference between 2.0.3 or 2.1 for extensions  
15:30 <vmassol> I don't know the rule and I don't know what to use as a conrib dev  
15:30 <vmassol> and as a user it means nothing  
15:30 <vmassol> you can't be guaranteed that you won't have regression when using a bugfix release  
15:31 <vmassol> there' also the issue of frequent releases for extensions  
15:31 <vmassol> personally I'd favor just 2 digits for extensions  
15:31 <vmassol> s/digitS/numbers  
15:31 <vmassol> A.B (major.minor)  
15:31 <vmassol> since we do frequent releases  
15:31 <vmassol> anyway....  
15:32 <vmassol> the reason that I'm mentipnig this is because we're starting to organize the contrib extensions ATM  
15:32 <vmassol> and we'll have more when we move platform stuff there  
15:34 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:36 <cjd> Drama in My IRC Channel?!  
15:36 <cjd> .77.99.55] has quit [K-Lined] <--  
15:37 <vmassol> bye bye alex, was nice to meet you!  
15:38 <evalica> I think that's maybe his quit message. We should not exagerate :) and caleb… maybe you have some work to do? :)  
15:38 <vmassol> apparently he's been banned from what cjd explained to me  
15:38 <cjd> mmm no, if it's his quit message then it says   has quit [Quit: "K-Lined"]  
15:39 <cjd> has quit [K-Lined]   == you upset an oper  
15:39 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
15:39 <cjd> wb
